tit.cmt: 「～命」は、オンライン用語集では、ハイフンがあるものとないものがありましたが、ハイフンがある方に統一しました

sen.j: 栲幡千千姫命（たくはたちぢひめのみこと）は、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)である。
sen.e: Takuhatachijihime-no-mikoto is a female deity (Shinto) in Japanese mythology.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リスト、レビュー結果 41行目のアマテラスの説明に合わせ、神はa female deityにしました。
sen.e: Takuhatachijihime-no-mikoto is a female deity (Shinto) in Japanese mythology.
Takuhatachijihime no Mikoto is a female deity (Shinto) in Japanese mythology.

sen.j: 古事記では萬幡豊秋津師比売命（よろづはたとよあきつしひめのみこと）と表記される。
sen.e: This goddess is described as Yorozuhatatoyoakitsushihime-no-mikoto in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This goddess is described as Yorozuhatatoyoakitsushihime-no-mikoto in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).
This goddess is described as Yorozuhatatoyoakitsushihime no Mikoto in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: 日本書紀本文では栲幡千千姫命と表記される。
sen.e: In the body of the "Nihon Shoki" (the Chronicle of Japan), she is also described as Yorozuhatachijihime-no-mikoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the body of the "Nihon Shoki" (the Chronicle of Japan), she is also described as Yorozuhatachijihime-no-mikoto.
In the body of the "Nihon Shoki" (the Chronicle of Japan), she is also described as Yorozuhatachijihime no Mikoto.

sen.j: 一書では栲幡千千媛萬媛命（たくはたちぢひめよろづひめのみこと）、天萬栲幡媛命（あめのよろづはたひめのみこと）、栲幡千幡姫命（たくはたちはたひめのみこと）と表記される。
sen.e: In the "alternate writing" transmitted by Nihonshoki, she is described as Takuhatachijihimeyorozuhime-no-mikoto, Amenoyorozuhatahime-no-mikoto, Takuhatachihatahime-no-mikoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処一書は、オンライン用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: In the "alternate writing" transmitted by Nihonshoki, she is described as Takuhatachijihimeyorozuhime-no-mikoto, Amenoyorozuhatahime-no-mikoto, Takuhatachihatahime-no-mikoto.
In the "alternate writing" transmitted by Nihonshoki, she is described as Takuhatachijihimeyorozuhime no Mikoto, Amenoyorozuhatahime no Mikoto, Takuhatachihatahime no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: as の後のスペース短縮「一書」の訳はすべて用語集のままとなっています。

sen.e: In the Mythology
In the Mythology
In the Mythology

sen.j: 葦原中国平定・天孫降臨の段に登場する。
sen.e: This goddess appears in the section of Ashihara no Nakatsukuniheitei (conquest of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni) and Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess)
sen.cmt: 葦原中国平定は、オンライン用語集に様々なバージョンがあったため、神道カテゴリのものの表記に合わせて、説明をかっこづきにし,ました。
sen.e: This goddess appears in the section of Ashihara no Nakatsukuniheitei (conquest of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni) and Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess)
This goddess appears in the section of Ashihara no Nakatsukuniheitei (conquest of Ashihara no Nakatsukuni) and Tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess)

sen.j: 古事記および日本書紀本文・第二・第六・第七・第八の一書ではタカミムスビ（高木神）の娘としている。
sen.e: She is a daughter of Takamimusubi (Takagi-no-kami) in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the body of "Nihon Shoki" (the Chronicle of Japan), and "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 2, vol. 6, vol. 7, and vol. 8.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She is a daughter of Takamimusubi (Takagi-no-kami) in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the body of "Nihon Shoki" (the Chronicle of Japan), and "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 2, vol. 6, vol. 7, and vol. 8.
She is a daughter of Takamimusubi (Takagi no kami) in "Kojiki", the body of "Nihon Shoki", and "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 2, vol. 6, vol. 7, and vol. 8.
sen.cmt: 古事記、日本書紀の説明削除ハイフン削除

sen.j: 日本書紀第一の一書ではオモイカネの妹と記されている。
sen.e: In the "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 1, she is written as a younger sister of Omoikane.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 1, she is written as a younger sister of Omoikane.
In the "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 1, she is written as a younger sister of Omoikane.

sen.j: 日本書紀第六の一書では「また曰く」として高皇産霊神の子の児火之戸幡姫の子（すなわち高皇産霊神の孫）と記されている。
sen.e: In the "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 6, she is also written as a child of Kohonotohata hime who is a daughter of Takamimusubi no kami (namely grandchild of Takamimusubi no kami).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 6, she is also written as a child of Kohonotohata hime who is a daughter of Takamimusubi no kami (namely grandchild of Takamimusubi no kami).

In the "alternate writing" transmitted by "Nihonshoki" vol. 6, she is also written as a child of Kohonotohata hime who is a daughter of Takamimusubi no kami (namely grandchild of Takamimusubi no kami).

sen.j: 天照大神の子のアメノオシホミミと結婚し、天火明命とニニギを産んだ。
sen.e: She got married with Amenooshihomimi, who is a son of Amaterasu omikami, and gave birth to Ame no Hoakari and Ninigi
sen.cmt: 天照大神は、オンライン用語集に複数のパターンがあり、Omikamiとするのかomikamiとするのかがわからなかったので、小文字のままにしました。天火明命は、オンライン用語集に合わせました。初出の場合は、(one of the gods in Japanese mythology)と説明するように記載されていますが、ここでは、すべてが神道の神の話しなので、説明は割愛しました。
sen.e: She was married with Amenooshihomimi, who is a son of Amaterasu omikami, and gave birth to Ame no Hoakari and Ninigi
She was married with Amenooshihomimi, who is a son of Amaterasu omikami, and gave birth to Ame no Hoakari and Ninigi.
Explanation
Explanation
Explanation

sen.j: 「栲」はコウゾの繊維、「ハタ」は「機（はた）」のことである。
sen.e: "Taku" means fiber of kouzo, paper mulberry and "hata" means a weaving machine.
"Taku" means fiber of kouzo, paper mulberry and "hata" means a weaving machine.
Taku' means fiber of kozo, paper mulberry and 'hata' means a weaving machine.

sen.j: 「チヂ」は縮むの意とも、たくさんあるの意ともいいます。
sen.e: "Chiji" means shrink or plenty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Chiji" means shrink or plenty.
Chiji means shrink or plenty.

sen.j: 前者であれば織地が縮んだ上質の織物のこととなり、後者であれば機織がさかんな様子を表す。
sen.e: If the meaning is shrink, it means a high-quality shrinked texture, and if the meaning is plenty, it shows plenty of weaving.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If the meaning is shrink, it means a high-quality shrinked texture, and if the meaning is plenty, it shows plenty of weaving.
If the meaning is shrink, it means a high-quality shrinked texture, and if the meaning is plenty, it shows plenty of weaving.

sen.j: いずれにしても機織や織物に関係のある名前ということになる。
sen.e: In either case, this name is related with weaving and textiles.
In either case, this name is related with weaving and textiles.
In either case, this name is related with weaving and textiles.

sen.j: 瓊瓊杵尊や天忍穂耳命とともに祀られることが多い。
sen.e: She is often enshrined with Ninigi-no-mikoto and Ameno oshihomimi-no-mikoto
She is often enshrined with Ninigi-no-mikoto and Ameno oshihomimi-no-mikoto
She is often enshrined with Ninigi no Mikoto and Ameno oshihomimi no Mikoto
